title: Trump’s Trade War Risks Forfeiting America’s Economic Primacy
description: The United States has steered an economic order for 75 years based on trade and trust, making the country the world’s financial superpower. That vision is now blurred.

title: Europe Has Economic Power. Can It Use It Against Trump’s Tariffs?
description: European leaders have said they would prefer to negotiate. If that fails, their response could go beyond anything they’ve tried before.

title: A Global Backlash to Trump’s Tariffs, and Deep Cuts to Public Health
description: Plus, a rare Beatles audition tape.

title: Laura Loomer Pushes Trump to Fire National Security Officials in Oval Office Meeting
description: During the 30-minute meeting, Laura Loomer excoriated National Security Council officials in front of the president and Michael Waltz, the national security adviser.

title: For Trump, Elon Musk Is a Liability, but Still Useful for Now
description: Elon Musk has become a valuable heat shield for a president who avoids blame at any cost.

title: Smithsonian’s Leader’s Future Unclear After Trump Executive Order
description: The president’s executive order demanding change at the institution presents a perilous test for Lonnie G. Bunch III, its secretary, whom the White House calls a partisan Democrat.

title: How Ukraine’s Environment Became a Casualty of Russia’s War
description: Russia’s war in Ukraine has decimated the environment, causing floods, wildfires and pollution. An extensive legal effort now underway in Ukraine is seeking justice for the long-lasting ecological harm. To capture the ecological damage of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, Brendan Hoffman, a New York Times photographer, visited much of the front line over four months of reporting.

title: Putin Envoy Says He’s in U.S. for Talks With Trump Administration
description: Kirill Dmitriev wrote on social media that his meetings were about restoring a U.S.-Russian dialogue that was “completely destroyed under the Biden administration.”

title: Hungary Says It Will Exit ICC as Netanyahu Visits
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, who is visiting Hungary despite facing an international arrest warrant, praised the move.

title: Israel Shifts Goal Posts in Gaza War
description: In pressing forward with its assault on the territory, Israel hopes to squeeze Hamas into releasing the remaining hostages. But other objectives have emerged.

title: Israel Hits Syria With New Strikes and Ground Raid as Tensions Soar
description: Israel defended the moves as necessary security measures, but Syria accused it of trying to destabilize the country.

title: What is ‘Qatargate,’ the Latest Furor Embroiling Israel?
description: This week, the police questioned Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu amid claims that members of his team worked simultaneously for the state of Qatar. He is not a suspect, but two of his media advisers have been arrested.

title: Bruce Springsteen Will Release Seven ‘Lost Albums’ in June
description: The singer and songwriter announced a boxed set featuring 83 songs, of which 74 have never been officially released in any form.

title: Joe DePugh, Pitcher Who Inspired Bruce Springsteen’s ‘Glory Days,’ Dead at 75
description: A gifted athlete, he gave a clumsy teenage Bruce Springsteen his first nickname, Saddie. Years later, the Boss returned the favor, memorializing him in a song.

title: Eric Adams Will Run for NYC Mayor as an Independent
description: Mayor Eric Adams faced an uphill battle in the June 24 Democratic primary, which has drawn a crowded field of candidates. He will run for re-election as an independent instead.

title: Trump’s Fight Against Antisemitism Has Become Fraught for Many Jews
description: American Jews have watched with both alarm and enthusiasm as strong-arm tactics, including arrests of activists, have been deployed in their name.

title: A Swastika, a Tesla and a Debate Over the Limits of Hate Crime Law
description: Is it a hate crime for people to draw a swastika on a Tesla if they believe Elon Musk is a Nazi?

title: A Gunman Returns to El Paso. So Does the Hateful Rhetoric That Inspired Him.
description: The lawyer of the white supremacist who slaughtered 23 people in 2019 said his client was inspired by President Trump’s words, the same the president is using today.

title: The Torlonia Marbles Offer Everything We Ask of Art
description: The 2,000-year-old Torlonia collection of Roman sculptures, now at the Art Institute of Chicago, has the urgency of the greatest contemporary art.

title: Tariffs Destroy What Makes America Great
description: Trump’s tariffs erect a wall between Americans and other people — a wall that obstructs not only the flow of goods, but the flow of ideas, contacts, technology and friendships.

title: The Childish Tariff Formula That Will Reshape the Global Economy
description: Trump said repeatedly that the tariffs are “reciprocal,” but that’s not true. The rates were calculated using a childish formula based on trade imbalances.

title: The Trade War Begins
description: We explain the sweeping tariff announcement and the world’s reaction.

title: Late Night Debriefs After a ‘Tariff-fying’ Day at the White House
description: Stephen Colbert said that, thanks to President Trump, “America is finally free from the tyranny of being able to buy stuff from other countries.”

title: South Korean Actress’s Suicide Spurs Scrutiny of Ex-Boyfriend
description: The death of the actress Kim Sae-ron has plunged her former boyfriend, the superstar actor Kim Soo-hyun, into the biggest crisis of his career.

title: Hong Kong Surfers Turn ‘Nothing Into Something’
description: The scene in the Chinese territory is concentrated at a few beaches with inconsistent swell. One intrepid surfer says it’s all about “turning nothing into something.”

title: The Country Was Fake. But Its Land Grab in Bolivia Was Real.
description: Emissaries of the “United States of Kailasa,” led by a fugitive holy man, were deported after negotiating 1,000-year deals with Indigenous groups.

title: A Pristine Family Photo. Then Barack Obama Strolls By.
description: The former president was taking a morning walk just as two young siblings posed with the Washington Monument and cherry blossoms serving as a perfect backdrop.

title: 600-Year-Old Fresco by Fra Angelico Gets Some Necessary Love
description: After three doctors fell in love with a fresco by Fra Angelico, they pledged to restore it so it could get its due when a blockbuster exhibition opens this fall.
